title: Gold and titania nanoparticles accumulated in the body induce late toxic effects and alterations in transcriptional and miRNA landscape
content:
Environ. Sci.: Nano, 2024, 11,1296-1313
DOI: 10.1039/D3EN00954H, Paper

Andrea Soltysova, Nicole Ludwig, Caroline Diener, Monika Sramkova, Katarina Kozics, Kristina Jakic, Lucia Balintova, Neus Gomez Bastus, Oscar Hernando Moriones, Aurelia Liskova, Zora Krivosikova, Eva Rollerova, Alena Manova, Tibor Dubaj, Victor Puntes, Peter Simon, Ladislava Wsolova, Jana Tulinska, Bozena Smolkova, Eckart Meese, Alena Gabelova
Conventional toxicological methods and integrated transcriptomic analysis were used to comprehensively assess the potential health hazard of residual metal nanoparticles accumulated in the body due to poor solubility.
